reviews.review_text: Easily the pinnacle of the Worms series. Everything that needed to be added to the earlier games without the more gimmicky and confusing content of the later games. This is the essence of Worms. Should delight fans of the series and newcomers alike. Easy enough to pick up and play, but perfecting the art of Wormfare is no small thing.

Worms Armageddon is one heck of a classic game, so why review it now?  Mostly because it's kinda newly released in Steam, but also because I've played it a lot with  friends the recent weeks.   Worms Armageddon is a game that's made to play with friends, if you have nothing to do between playing a game of CS:GO and are too tired to get back to your Campaign in Civilization V, than look at Worms Armageddon. With Worms Armageddon you can murder your friends with a Banana Bomb, or throw a huge metal Donkey on them.  The game has a wide variety with weapons, everything from MMA to rocket launchers.   If you see a worm on the edge of the beach, should you kill him with your shotgun or perhaps your grenade?  Or why not only stand beside him and push him into the water. (Protip: Worms can't swim)  The game is 2D and you can only walk to the left and right, and jump. There is a map creator so you wont ever  run out of maps, I can also recommend playing on an empty map, just try it, It's fun.  Either way, if you are bored and have friends, get this game, play it with them.   You won't regret it! (Hopefully)

The best artillery game ever made and one of the best turn-based strategy games ever made. This ain't an opinion, this game still holds up today and it was released almost 17 years ago.  PROS: - Timeless, humorous 2d graphics that make even the most gruesome worm death look funny. - Rewarding turn-based gameplay that focuses on strategy and being careful. One small mistake can ♥♥♥♥ your whole game up. - Randomly generated levels provide a new experience every single game, and if that's not good enough for you, you can even make your own levels. You spoiled ♥♥♥♥♥ucker. - Customization options up the ♥♥♥♥in ♥♥♥, you can set your team of worms to speak Chinese or even Polish for christ's sake. Although granted the Polish voice is annoying as ♥♥♥. - The soundtrack kicks ♥♥♥ even after 2 decades. There's nothing like sneaking around and setting a stick of lit dynamite under a worms ♥♥♥ while some super sexy bass line plays in the background. ♥♥♥♥. - The developers, Team 17, still and I mean STILL support this game. It's 2016 and they're still releasing patches and fixes for this ♥♥♥♥in game man. Now that's dedication. This ain't like modern games where the devs abandon that ♥♥♥♥ after like 2 months. These guys are the real deal. Team 17, just for that, I'll let all of you bang my wife. Free of charge. You guys earned it.  CONS: - The AI is infamous in this game because it blatantly ♥♥♥♥ing cheats. Jesus christ, I can't tell you how many times I've wanted to punch a hole through my monitor over the years because some ♥♥♥♥ing smug computer-controlled worm threw a grenade across the ♥♥♥♥in level that just so happened to land right next to my worm. I can't really complain about this though because it just makes the game more challenging, so stop being such a ♥♥♥♥♥.  BUY THIS GAME, NERD.

Worms: Reloaded, Revolution, Clan Wars- they're not terrible by a far stretch, but they all try to do one thing- recapture this exact game. The 3D rendered 2D gameplay offered by the newer iterations is very pretty, and water weapons, physics objects, worm classes, and so much more do make for great games, however they all still fail to capture exactly this game. It's hard to articulate exactly how perfect and balanced this is. Maybe it's the range of weapons that includes your typical bazookas and grenades alongside magic bullets and sheep strikes. Maybe it's the way it feels so much more responsive over all other iterations allowing for perfectly timed ninja rope swings. Hell maybe it's just nostalgia. One thing I can say though is that even after 15+ years, this game is THE Worms game that we all love and play. It's THE gold standard of Worms games that has yet to be matched. This game has a brilliant art style, ample options for customisation and map creation, is nicely patched to run on modern systems with a myriad of lovely little tweaks to keep it going, and is still one of the best local co-op games I have ever played. I can think of plenty of worse things to spend a tenner on!

The predecessor Worms II was quite a fun game with its hilarious cartoon animations and gameplay. Worms Armageddon is a seriously enhanced/expanded Worms II, becoming the best of the franchise in my opinion.  Most of the rest misses 'it' in the later games. During the effort of turning the franchise up-to-date-ish, putting it in 3D did not help the game mechanics at all. Nothing was as much fun as SuperSheep-ing the hell out of the opponent in the good old 2D.   Fortunately Worms Revolution realised that and re-discovered that perspective again using 3D just as briefly as it should have been used from the beginning so it is some sort of follow-up of Woms Armageddon where this game concept worked the best. It is a challenging game with a sense of humour and some nasty hostilities against your opponents. It is best to play hotseat (like in old times) with a couple of friends. After 10 rounds and a couple of holy grenade drops and ninja rope swings, the term 'friend' will get a new meaning.  May the concrete donkey be with you.
